name: Same As It Ever Was Action Figure
description:
Digital custom action figure representation of “Same as it Ever Was”, House of Pain’s follow-up to their breakthrough debut “Fine Malt Lyrics” or, as most people know it: ‘the one with “Jump Around” in it'. 

Released in 1994, the album never reach the commercial success of its predecessor. Which is - I dare say- CRIMINAL, since it was such a fuckin’ PERFECT album from start to finish. That fantastic cover, a close up shot of a boxer getting his lights punched the fuck out of him, is the most appropriate visual summary of the non-stop audio barrage contained within. This album held nothing back to absolutely SLAPPED the shit out of its listeners, with a deadly combo of peak-90’s-Soul Assassins-production bodyslams and Everlast’s heavy growl delivery ground-and-pound beatdowns, all while Danny Boy spouts his signature nonsense trash-talks and generally just doing Danny Boy things. 

Exquisitely mixing its crisp and tight production while keeping it rough around the edges at the same time, “Same as it Ever Was” should definitely go down in history as one of the crown-jewels of 90’s hip hop, and today -26 years later- it remain as hard as it ever was.  
 
Card is made from Same as it Ever Was cover shot.

Figure is made from repainted NECA’s Rocky Series 2 figure.
